name: Milk masala
description: For the Home-made special masala milk powder
method: Set a pan on medium heat and dry roast the almonds, pistachios & cashew nuts.
Remove off heat after 3-4 minutes & cool them down.

Now in a mixer grinder add the roasted nuts, saffron, black pepper, grated nutmeg, milk powder, turmeric & milk powder. The milk powder gives the milk the extra creaminess. You could avoid if you do not have it.
Grind it in pulse mode in short batches

name: Khandvi
description: For the Home-made special masala milk powder
method: In a bowl add the buttermilk, besan, salt, hing& turmeric powder, whisk it well using a whisk so that no lumps remain.
Pour the batter into a nonstick pan & cook over low heat until it becomes thick & achieves a slight shine, this process will take 25 minutes, make sure you keep stirring the batter continuously.

Once cooked place some portion of the batter onto the backside of a tray or a plate, cover the pan to keep the remaining batter hot, then using a scrapper or a spatula spread the batter on the surface into a thin sheet & as evenly as possible, spread the remaining batter on other plates similarly & let it cool down for 10 minutes.
Once cooled, make cuts of 2-3 inches & then roll the khandvi from one end to the other, roll all the other khandvis Similarly, you can keep the thickness of the khandvi as per your preference.
To make the tadka, set a pan over high heat & once it gets hot add in the oil & let the oil heat up as well.
Add in all mustard seeds and sesame seeds stir briefly & pour the tadka over the khandvis.
Your delicious khandvi is ready, garnish with fresh coriander & fresh desiccated coconut & serve.
